summary: Discussion about whether the `condition` function should use strict boolean checks (=== true) instead of truthy checks. Users might expect `condition(() => array.length)` to work like an if statement, but truthy values could cause unexpected behavior.
userImpact: Users may encounter unexpected behavior when using the condition function with truthy values that aren't strictly true, leading to confusing workflow execution.
rootCause: The condition function uses truthy evaluation (if (cond.fn())) instead of strict boolean checking (if (cond.fn() === true)), which differs from standard if statement semantics.
resolutionDetails: Acknowledged as too late to change at this point in the SDK's development without breaking changes.
keyQuote: I think a lot of users would expect that condition behaves like an `if` statement. For example, one might expect `condition(() => array.length)` to resolve when there are new elements added to the array.
